FuncDef:
The pic power-on-delay command enables a subcard to automatically power on and configures the delay time for the subcard to power on automatically.
The undo pic power-on-delay command disables a subcard from automatically powering on and deletes the delay time.
The board power-on-delay command enables a board to automatically power on and configures the delay time for the board to power on automatically.
undo board power-on-delay command disables a board from automatically powering on and deletes the delay time.
By default, a subcard is disabled from powering on automatically. No delay time is configured for the subcard to power on automatically.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the delay time for a subcard or a board to power on automatically.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 65535, in minutes.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
If a board or subcard is powered off permanently due to unstable power supply, an user has to remove and insert the board or subcard on site to power it on. To save the labor and enable a board or subcard to power on automatically, a user can run the pic board power-on-delay command and specify the parameter.
Follow-up Procedure
Run the display board power-on-delay command after a board is enabled to power on automatically. The command output displays the delay time for the board to power on automatically.
Run the display pic power-on-delay command after a subcard is enabled to power on automatically. The command output displays the delay time for the subcard to power on automatically.
Run the display pic power-on-delay command after a subcard is enabled to power on automatically. The command output displays the delay time for the subcard to power on automatically.
Precautions
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
